Because the smell was very delicious, it came to mean ‚Äúfragrant‚Äù or ‚Äúdelicious‚Äù in the present times.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " millet ", from " gan ", the original meaning is the smell of grains after ripening, and by extension it refers to all good smells and aromas. "Said Wen": "Fang Ye. From the millet to the sweet. "The Legend of the Spring and Autumn Period" says: millet is fragrant. Every fragrance belongs to the fragrance." "Poetry¬∑Daya¬∑Shengmin": "Mao is prosperous in beans, in beans Yu Deng, his incense began to rise, and God is inhabited."

" Fragrant " can mean delicious taste; sweet. "L√º Shi Chunqiu ‚Äß Examining Time": "The time is the millet... the pounding is easy, and the food is not lingering but fragrant." Gao You's note: "Fragrant, beautiful."

" Scent " also means cherished or praised. Tang Wangwei's "Juvenile Trip" 2nd: "Who knows whether or not to suffer from the side court, you can still hear the fragrance of chivalry if you die."

" Fragrant " also means wonderful. Tang Libai's "The Song of Picking Lotus": "The moon shines with new makeup and the bottom of the water is bright, and the wind is scented in the air."

" Fragrance " also refers to spices or their products. Cao Cao of the Three Kingdoms "Internal Commandment Decree": "In the past, the world was initially set, so I banned fragrances in the house."

" Incense " also refers to offering incense and incense. Song Taogu's "Records of Qingyi¬∑Shizu": "There is an iron incense burner in the Fengchan Temple in Bianzhou...a wooden cabinet is locked by the fireside, and the top is closed. The wanderer finishes the incense, and the real person casts the cabinet with white water."

" Fragrant " also means seasoning with aromatic ingredients. Jia Sixie of the Northern Wei Dynasty "Qi Min Yao Shu‚Äß Kind of Garlic": "Ze garlic can be fragrant, and the Wu people use it more frequently."

Basic explanation of words
Fragrant
xiƒÅng
The smell is good, as opposed to "stinky": fragrance. Mellow. aromatic. Fragrant.
Comfortable: sleep soundly.
It tastes good: this fish is really fragrant.
Popular: This kind of goods is very fragrant in the countryside.
Call some natural or artificial scented things: musk. Civet fragrance. Ambergris. sandalwood. Agarwood.
In the old days, it was used to describe women's things or as a pronoun for women: Xiang Gui. Fragrant.
A thin strip made of sawdust and spice burned by ancestors and gods: incense. Burn incense and pray. incense burner. Incense candles.
name.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]ÔºªxiƒÅngÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Xu Liangqie, Pingyang, Xiao. ]
Also known as "È∫ç1". Also known as "È∫ò1".
(1) This refers to the smell of grains after ripening, and by extension it refers to all good smells and aromas.
(2) It tastes delicious; sweet.
(3) Said to be cherished or praised.
(4) It's wonderful. Mostly used to describe women's things.
(5) By referring to a wonderful woman.
(6) Borrowing refers to flowers.
(7) Describe a good appetite.
(8) Describes a solid and sound sleep.
(9) A metaphor for intimacy and beauty.
(10) Kiss.
(11) Spices or their products.
(12) Offering incense and scenting incense.
(13) Season with flavorful ingredients.
(14) It means to inhale or drink something with fragrance.
(15) Last name. There was Xiangju in the Warring States Period. See Han Liu Xiang's "New Preface¬∑Thorn Luxury".
